definition: road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
Germany/German/abbr. for 德國|德国[De2 guo2]

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: A statesman cannot afford to be a moralist.
sentences.chinese: 政治家無法成爲道德家。

sentences.english: Some Heathen moralists also have taught very much the same lesson.
sentences.chinese: 一些非基督教的道德家，也說過大體相同的教言。

sentences.english: 11-13 This is a matter which has been too little considered, both by moralists and by social reformers.
sentences.chinese: 在這件事上，道德家和社會改革家都考慮得太少了。

sentences.english: That teach the rustic moralist to die.
sentences.chinese: 教訓鄉里的道德家們怎樣去死。

sentences.english: This is a matter which has been too little considered, both by moralists and by social reformers.
sentences.chinese: 在這件事上，道德家和社會改革家都考慮得太少了。

pinyin: gong1 gong4 zhi1 shi5 fen4 zi3
